intro: Barbacenia rodriguesii, commonly known as Rodrigues's barbacenia, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, showy bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its small, inconspicuous true flowers are surrounded by brightly colored, leaf-like structures that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
